AWS ML is a powerful platform that can be used to build a wide range of machine-learning applications. It is worth learning about AWS ML, especially if you are interested in a career in machine learning. There are a number of good resources available for learning about AWS ML. One of the best resources is the AWS documentation. The #AWS documentation is comprehensive and well-written, and it covers all aspects of AWS ML. Found a similar good post from AWS on ML. Worth watching... https://lnkd.in/d_Vc4EfY #aws #awscloud #cloudcomputing #awscommunity

View my verified achievement from Amazon Web Services (AWS). Takeaways: 1) It was useful to see how AWS "officially" approached solving ML/AI problems I already encounter. 2) I am now much more confident about the breadth of my knowledge in ML/AI, and I know what tools to reach for in a much wider range of tasks.

ðŸŽ‰ AWS brings choice to the Foundation Model world, diversity is the right-most focus as not one GenAI model works for all situation (right tool, right task). Bedrocks supports LLAMA 2, Claude, Titan (AWS trained models), and many more. Their ease of use and breadth of catalog enables organizations to explore, innovate, and do so with low risk. Interested to learn more? Check out NearForm where out team can help you apply all these amazing new innovations from Amazon Web Services (AWS) for your business today. #aws #awscloud #awsreinvent #awsreinvent2023

Good to understand what is the art of possible with ML in real world. Business problem framing to ML problem framing. What makes sense with ML and what doesnt. This is the go to course for that. Amazon Web Services (AWS) #ML #AWS #upskill #problemframing
